children.name: brother a1
children.definition: brother a man or boy with the same parents as another person : anh; em trai
examples: i have two brothers, william and mark.
an older/ elder brother
i have two older brothers.
a big brother(older brother - used especially by or to children )
jake was my big brother and i admired him.
a younger brother
do you have any younger brothers?
a little brother/ a kid brother[us] (= younger brother )
my kid brother was always annoying me.
a baby brother(= brother who is still a baby )
mum let me hold my new baby brother.
a twin brother
luke and his twin brother sam went everywhere together.
a half-brother(= brother with only one parent the same as yours )
i never really liked my half-brother.
a step-brother(= the son of your stepfather or stepmother )
his dad’s new wife brought him two step-brothers.

children.name: sister a1
children.definition: sister a girl or woman who has the same parents as another person
examples: sophie and emily are sisters.
an older sister/ an elder sister[especially uk]
he had two older sisters, karen and jacqueline.
a big sister(= an older sister )
she misses her big sister dreadfully.
a younger sister
mary showed a lot of aggressive behaviour towards her younger sister.
a little/ kid sister(= a younger sister )
she was very fond of her little sister.
a baby sister(a sister who is still a baby)
he wanted a baby sister.
a twin sister
he is devoted to his twin sister.
a half-sister(a sister with only one parent the same as yours)
she doesn't see her half-sister very often.
sisterhood[ u ] the relationship between sisters : tình chị em
it was sisterhood that made her care for me as she did.

children.name: sibling c2
children.definition: sibling  a brother or sister : anh chị em ruột
examples: i have four siblings: three brothers and a sister.
most young smokers are influenced by their friends’ and older siblings’ smoking habits.
sibling rivalry[competition between brothers and sisters for their parents’ attention or love]
there was great siblingrivalrybetween peter and his brother.

children.name: in-laws x
children.definition: in-laws informal the parents of your husband or wife: ba mẹ chồng hoặc vợ
examples: we lived with my in-laws until we had enough money to buy a house of our own.

children.name: stepmother b2
children.definition: stepmother/ stepson/ stepsister etc sb who becomes your mother, sister, son etc when you or a person you are related to marries for a second time: mẹ ghẻ...
examples: after my mother got remarried, it took a while to get used to having a stepfather.
she has two sisters and a stepbrother.

children.name: mother-in-law b2
children.definition: mother-in-law/ son-in-law etc sb who is related to you because of a marriage, for example, your mother-in-law is the mother of your wife or husband, and your sister-in-law is the sister of your wife or husband, or the wife of your brother: mẹ chồng, vợ
examples: surprisingly, my mother-in-law and i get along very well.
my sister and brother-in-law are coming to visit next week.

children.name: godmother x
children.definition: godparent/ godmother/ godson etc (in the christian religion) a person who is related to you because of promises at a baptism ceremony.

children.name: son a1
children.definition: son someone’s male child: con trai
examples: we have two teenage sons.
her son used to work in texas.
the family business has now been taken over by anderson’s eldest son.
son of
the son of a poor farmer

prodigal son[c noun usually s] a man or boy who has left his family in order to do something that the family disapprove of and has now returned home feeling sorry for what he has done : đứa con hoang toàng
[figurative]manchester city football club sees the return of the prodigal son tonight with black once again in the side after a season away.

children.name: daughter a1
children.definition: daughter someone’s female child: con gái
examples: our youngest daughter is getting married next month.
my aunt has five daughters and three sons.
in traditional societies, parents were often reluctant to send their daughters to school.
daughter of
the daughter of an english king

children.name: little girl a1
children.definition: little girl  sb’s young daughter:
examples: paula had to go home - her little girl’s sick.

children.name: little boy a1
children.definition: little boy  sb’s young son:
examples: ‘how old’s your little boy?’ ‘he’s three.’

children.name: offspring c2
children.definition: offspring  sb’s children: con
examples: sb’s offspring
parents with the disease are likely to pass it on to their offspring.
hardly a day goes by without mrs molt or one of her offspring calling around to borrow something.

children.name: child a1
children.definition: child sb’s son or daughter, of any age: đứa con
examples: she named her first child katrin.
one of her children lives in australia now.
the house seems very quiet now that all the children have left home.
an only childa child that has no brothers or sisters
alexandra was an only child and the centre of her mother’s world.

children.name: kid b1
children.definition: kid informal sb’s son or daughter - use this about children aged up to 14 or 15:
examples: all i ever wanted was to get married and have kids.
could you look after the kids this evening?

children.name: twin b1
children.definition: twin one of two children who were born on the same day to the same mother: con sinh đôi
examples: i never realized that you and sammy were twins
joey’s my twin.
twin brother/ sister
sally and her twin sister still spend a lot of time together now that they are adults.
identical twinstwins who look exactly the same
there have been a lot of interesting studies done on identical twins separated at birth.
fraternal twinstwins who do not look the same
noelle and craig are fraternal twins.

children.name: grandfather a2
children.definition: grandfather (informalgrandpa/grandad) the father of a person's mother or father
examples: my grandfather was a farmer.
my grandpa died when i was a baby.
ask grandpa if he'll buy us an ice cream.
grandad collects me from school on fridays.

children.name: grandmother a2
children.definition: grandmother (informalgrandma/ granny/ gran) the mother of a person's father or mother
examples: she looks just like grandmother.
i was at my grandma's house yesterday.
granny, can i come with you?

children.name: grandparent a2
children.definition: grandparent one of the parents of your mother or father :
examples: my grandparents live in sussex.

children.name: grandson a2
children.definition: grandson the son of a person's son or daughter : cháu trai

children.name: grandaughter a2
children.definition: granddaughter the daughter of a person's son or daughter : cháu gái

children.name: grandchild a2
children.definition: grandchild cháu
examples: the child of a person's son or daughter

children.name: cousin a2
children.definition: cousin (first cousin) a child of a person's aunt or uncle, or, more generally, a distant (= not close) relation : anh/chị/em họ
examples: my brother's wife and i both had babies around the same time, so the cousins are very close in age.
many of ourdistantcousins, whom we hadn't seen for years, came to my sister's wedding.

children.name: uncle a2
children.definition: uncle chú; bác; cậu; dượng
examples: the brother of someone's mother or father, or the husband of someone's aunt
i've got several uncles and aunts.
we invited my uncle steve round.
[ as form of address]did you bring me a present, uncle jack?

children.name: niece b1
children.definition: niece cháu gái (con của anh, chị, em)
examples: a daughter of your brother or sister, or a daughter of your husband's or wife's brother or sister

children.name: aunt a2
children.definition: aunt (alsoauntie/aunty) cô, dì, thím, mợ, bác gái
examples: the sister of someone's father or mother, or the wife of someone's uncle
i have an aunt in australia.
auntie camille

children.name: nephew b1
children.definition: nephew cháu trai (con của anh, chị, em)
examples: a son of your sister or brother, or a son of the sister or brother of your husband or wife

children.name: father a1
children.definition: father
examples: my father’s a doctor.
father of
he’s now the proud father of a three-week-old baby girl.
larry blake, a father of three children, was shot dead outside his home last night.
birth father[a child’s natural father, rather than a man who has become the child’s legal father through adoption]
a father of two/ three/ four etc(a man with two, three etc children)
the driver, a father of four, escaped uninjured.
steve recently became the proud father of a 7lb 12oz baby girl.

children.name: folks b2
children.definition: folks  informal your family, especially your parents: cha mẹ
examples: she’s gone back home to see her folks.
my folks were waiting for me at the station.
i'm going home to see my folks.

children.name: mother a1
children.definition: mother
examples: my mother and father are both teachers.
all the mothersand fathershad been invited to the end-of-term concert.
[ as form of address] formal or old-fashionedmay i borrow your car, mother?
birth mother[a child’s natural mother, rather than a woman who has become the child’s legal mother through adoption]
a single mother[a mother who looks after her children on her own, without a husband or partner]
as a single mother, linda relies on state benefits which are nowhere near enough.

children.name: parents a1
children.definition: parents sb’s mother and father:
examples: do you get on well with your parents?
parents need to become more involved in their children’s school activities.
i'm going to meet richard's parents for the first time this weekend.
sb’s birth parents(the ones who are biologically related to them)
only half the children who are adopted wish to discover their birth parents.
sb’s biological/ natural parents
most children are reared by their natural parents.
sb’s real parents(their biological parents )
i was thrilled to have found my real parents.
a single parent/ lone parent[uk](sb who has their children living with them, but no partner)
my mum is a single parent.
adoptive parents(the people who take someone else's child into their home and legally become his or her parents )
adoptive parents often have little practical preparation for parenthood.
a foster parent(sb who has other people's children living with them)
teresa was removed from her mother's care and placed with foster parents.

children.name: dad a1
children.definition: dad informal a name you use to talk to your father or to talk about sb else’s father:
examples: was your dad angry when you got home?
can i borrow your car, dad?
my dad retired ten years ago.

children.name: old man x
children.definition: old man informal father - use this to talk about your father or sb else’s father: ông già, lão già
examples: my old man never could understand why i married doris.
the old manmy father
i’m going to visit the old man next week.

children.name: mom a1
children.definition: mum /mom  informal sb’s mother:
examples: my mum and dad won’t mind if you want to stay the night.
alex’s mom does all his cooking, washing, and ironing for him!
sometimes it’s difficult to get back into the job market after being a full-time mom.
a single mum/ moma [mother who looks after her children on her own, without a husband or partner]
being a single mum is never easy.
a stay-at-home-mom[a mother who stays at home to take care of her children rather than working elsewhere
